title: Tom Brady ‘was supposed’ to play for Raiders upon leaving Patriots, Las Vegas owner Mark Davis said
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady nearly joined the Las Vegas Raiders as a quarterback in 2020, according to owner Mark Davis.
Brady, a six-time Super Bowl winner with the Patriots, instead joined the Tampa Bay Buccaneers as a free agent.
Brady became a minority owner of the Raiders in May 2023 and is also FOX's top NFL color commentator.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Friendship,' starring Tim Robinson and Paul Rudd, is streaming on HBO Max as a quirky comedy.
'Highest 2 Lowest,' a Spike Lee remake starring Denzel Washington, is available on Apple TV+.
'The Great British Baking Show' season 16 is streaming on Netflix with judges Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith.

title: What Jakobi Meyers and the Raiders are saying about the Patriots ahead of season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers will face his former team, the New England Patriots, as a Las Vegas Raider Sunday in Foxborough.
Pete Carroll, new head coach of the Raiders, comments on Patriots' strong front seven and their challenging running game.
Raiders players and staff acknowledge the Patriots' physical defense as a key factor in their upcoming matchup.

title: Jaylen Brown gives his own take on Boston Tea Party in stream with IShowSpeed
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown joined YouTuber IShowSpeed on a live stream tour of Boston, including activities like visiting a Boston Tea Party Ship.
During the stream, Brown humorously referenced the Boston Tea Party while dumping buckets of tea into the water.
Brown and IShowSpeed raced in Downtown Crossing, with IShowSpeed narrowly winning but allegedly injuring his hamstring.

title: Dante Scarnecchia likes what he sees from Patriots rookie Will Campbell
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rookie Will Campbell is set to make his NFL debut as starting left tackle against the Raiders on Sunday.
Veteran coach Dante Scarnecchia praises Campbell's dynamic run blocking, noting no concerns over his arm length limitations.
Campbell excelled in preseason, earning high PFF grades but faces a test against Raiders' Maxx Crosby in his debut.

title: ‘That’s their prerogative’: Mike Vrabel responds to Bill Belichick’s ban on Patriots scouts at UNC
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel comments on Bill Belichick's ban preventing New England scouts from attending UNC practices and games.
Belichick took the UNC coaching job after leaving the Patriots, where his exit was reportedly contentious with owner Robert Kraft.
Belichick's debut at UNC resulted in a 48-14 loss to TCU, marking a rough start to his college coaching career.

title: Woman who was allegedly filmed in the shower at URI is suing the school
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A woman filed a lawsuit against the University of Rhode Island after allegedly being filmed in a unisex dorm shower.
She accuses URI of negligence and defamation, claiming lax bathroom security and misleading media statements worsened her situation.
The alleged perpetrator, James Paquette, faces a state-level charge of video voyeurism, and URI has not commented on the lawsuit.

title: Christian Gonzalez to miss Patriots’ season opener, Will Campbell questionable vs. Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez ruled out for Patriots' season opener against Raiders due to a hamstring injury.
Rookie left tackle Will Campbell is questionable for Sunday's game with an ankle injury; was limited in practice.
Patriots defensive tackle Christian Barmore limited in practice, but not due to injury; his status is not on the report.

title: Jayson Tatum’s Celtics teammate has a positive update on star’s recovery from Achilles tear
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum is progressing in his recovery from a ruptured Achilles tendon, as reported by teammate Jordan Walsh.
Tatum has been a frequent presence at the Celtics' practice facility, despite no set timeline for his return.
The Celtics are not committing to a timeline for Tatum's return, focusing instead on his full recovery.

title: 5 things to know about the Raiders ahead of Sunday’s matchup against the Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Pete Carroll and Geno Smith, reunited in Las Vegas, are leading the Raiders with a history of moderate success together.
Tight end Brock Bowers set rookie records last season and is projected as a top performer for 2025.
The Raiders haven't won in Foxborough since 1994, despite playing there only three times since 2002.
